user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_TaskMatch_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_TaskMatch_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    OS_impl_task_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_task_table, *token);

    if (pthread_equal(pthread_self(), impl->id) == 0)
    {
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_TaskMatch_Impl:
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef struct
{
    pthread_t id;
} OS_impl_task_internal_record_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_task_internal_record_t OS_impl_task_table[OS_MAX_TASKS]
...
static inline osal_index_t OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    return token->obj_idx;
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The macro OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET expands to &tbl[...], yielding a pointer to a non-const OS_impl_task_internal_record_t. In OS_TaskMatch_Impl the returned pointer is assigned to OS_impl_task_internal_record_t *impl and only read (impl->id). According to MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 the pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible (i.e. const OS_impl_task_internal_record_t *impl), so returning/using a non-const pointer here violates the rule.
